data.event: The county was formed in 1795 from parts of Woodford, Mercer and Shelby counties, and was named after the American inventor and statesman Benjamin Franklin.
The three original counties of Kentucky (Jefferson, Fayette and Lincoln counties) intersected in what is today Franklin County.
Franklin County was established in 1795 from land given by Mercer, Shelby, and Woodford counties.
In 2000 Democrat Al Gore won 50% of the vote to Republican George W. Bush's 47%.
In 2004, Bush won 50% of the vote to Democrat John Kerry's 48%.
In 2008 Republican John McCain defeated Democrat Barack Obama 49.47% to 48.87%, a difference of only 144 votes.
